authors.name: Andrea R Daniel
authors.note: This protocols was adapted form the M. Brown lab at Duke University

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"37te9","text":"Flow cytometry of tumor tissue and blood from mice with human tumors. Mice bearing HCC1954 tumors were euthanized at days 3 and 19 post CAR T cel delivery. This protocol describes methods for preparing input CAR T cells and tumor infiltrating CAR T cells for phenotypic characterization of by flow cytometry. Data collection can be performed using a Fortessa X 20 and analyzed using Flow Jo V10.8.1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

  2 ","","Human Panel 3","","Antigen","flurophore",null,null,null],["GFP","CD45","","GFP","CD45","","GFP","CD45","","Zombie live/dead","APCy7"],["MYC","APC","","MYC","APC","","MYC","APC","","CD3","BUV737"],["Live Dead","APCcy7","","Live Dead","APCcy7","","Live Dead","APCcy7","","CD8","BUV395"],["CD3","BUV737","","CD3","BUV737","","CD3","BUV737","","CD4","BV510"],["CD8","BUV395","","CD8","BUV395","","CD8","BUV395","","TiGIT","BV605"],["TIGIT","BV605","","CD39","PECF594","","TNF","BV605","","LAG3","BV786"],["LAG3","BV786","","CD56","BV605","","LAG3","BV786","","PD1","BV711"],["CD127","PERCPcy5.5","","CD45RO","BV786","","TIM3","PEcy5","","TIM3","PEcy5"],["Granzyme B","Pecy7","","CD45RA","PEcy5","","ID2","PeCy7","","TCF1","BV421"],["PD1","BV711","","CD28","PeCy7","","CXCR3","BV711","","Ki67","BV510"],["TIM3","PEcy5","","CCR7","BV711","","CD4","BV510","","ID3","PE"],["TCF1","BV421","","CD62L","BV510","","GATA3","BV421","","ID2","PEcy7"],["Ki67","BV510","","CTLA4","BV421","","IRF4","PERCP cy5.5","","",""],["IFNg","PE","","Tbet","PERCP cy5.5","","ID3","PE","","",""],["CD39","PECF594","","EOMEs","PE","","","","","",""]],"guid":"04708411EEF9443B826F1EC720075D67","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":[],"printData":[["HUMAN Panel 1 main","","HUMAN panel
  2 ","","Human Panel 3","","Antigen","flurophore",null,null,null],["GFP","CD45","","GFP","CD45","","GFP","CD45","","Zombie live/dead","APCy7"],["MYC","APC","","MYC","APC","","MYC","APC","","CD3","BUV737"],["Live Dead","APCcy7","","Live Dead","APCcy7","","Live Dead","APCcy7","","CD8","BUV395"],["CD3","BUV737","","CD3","BUV737","","CD3","BUV737","","CD4","BV510"],["CD8","BUV395","","CD8","BUV395","","CD8","BUV395","","TiGIT","BV605"],["TIGIT","BV605","","CD39","PECF594","","TNF","BV605","","LAG3","BV786"],["LAG3","BV786","","CD56","BV605","","LAG3","BV786","","PD1","BV711"],["CD127","PERCPcy5.5","","CD45RO","BV786","","TIM3","PEcy5","","TIM3","PEcy5"],["Granzyme B","Pecy7","","CD45RA","PEcy5","","ID2","PeCy7","","TCF1","BV421"],["PD1","BV711","","CD28","PeCy7","","CXCR3","BV711","","Ki67","BV510"],["TIM3","PEcy5","","CCR7","BV711","","CD4","BV510","","ID3","PE"],["TCF1","BV421","","CD62L","BV510","","GATA3","BV421","","ID2","PEcy7"],["Ki67","BV510","","CTLA4","BV421","","IRF4","PERCP cy5.5","","",""],["IFNg","PE","","Tbet","PERCP cy5.5","","ID3","PE","","",""],["CD39","PECF594","","EOMEs","PE","","","","","",""]],"rowHeights":[]}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6j114","text":"     Place mice under deep isoflurane anesthesia (5% isoflurane, minimum of 15 minutes)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3mot","text":"     Spray the abdomen of the mouse with 70% ethanol, this is to avoid fur contamination of samples","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3daht","text":"     Perform a bilateral thoracotomy, cut the right atrium of the heart.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ercgr","text":"     Collect blood using a 1ml pipette and place in a labelled EDTA tube (2ml K2 coated EDTA)- mix and store at room temperature (RT) until processing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f2jac","text":"     Dissect the tumor from the skin, place in a labelled 5ml tube containing ice cold RPMI 1640 (no serum); place sample on ice until processing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2kob5","text":"     Add 1ml RBC lysis buffer (Thermo) directly to the blood tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3bafm","text":"     Transfer to a labelled FACS tube and place at 4oC until downstream processing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":52,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6rsnt","text":"     Immediately prior to staining with Zombie live/dead dye, centrifuge (500Gx3min), and dump supernatant, retaining the cell pellet ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7mod2","text":"     Place 5ml of dissociation solution in a 50ml conical for each mouse tumor labelled with corresponding ID ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"btbqh","text":"     Remove the tumor with forceps and place in a 60mm dish","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7ea51","text":"     Use a #10 scalpel to mince the tumor tissue","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4rvqj","text":"     Transfer the minced tumor tissue into the 50ml conical containing 5ml dissociation media- using the scalpel to dump tumor tissue into the tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"nqsr","text":"     Clean the forceps and scalpel in 70% ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2bp9v","text":"     Repeat steps 16-19 until for all tumors. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1602v","text":"     Once all samples are minced and in dissociation media, put tubes in a 37C shaker set to rotate at 200rpm for 45min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4t87f","text":"     After incubation in step 21, use a 5 ml serological pipet to pipet up and down tumor tissue, force through a 70micron cell strainer back into the same 50ml tube, sliding the pipet back and forth over the cell strainer to mechanically dissociate any remaining fragments.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"769qe","text":"10.  Using the same strainer, pipette the solution through the strainer into corresponding FACs tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cak8m","text":"11.  After all samples are complete, spin at 500gx3min at RT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ddmur","text":"     Prepare dissociation media, enough for 5ml per tumor (e.g. if 15 tumors prepare 75ml), mix well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"853pa","text":"     Ensure no more than ~50ul volume of cell pellet (using reference FACs tube with 50ul water as guide) is stained, remove cell volume as needed to maintain under this amount; excessive cell density can impair staining and introduce artifacts. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dl0ls","text":"     Add 100ul of PBS containing 1:500 Zombie NIR (Biolegend, diluted in 100ul per manufacturer instructions) and 1:500 DNAse I (to prevent clumping).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d6qa1","text":"     Add 1ml of FACs buffer (2% FBS in PBS) to each sample to neutralize the Zombie staining ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7o2sg","text":"10.  Add mouse and human FC block at 1ul per sample in FACS buffer at 100ul per tube (make a master mix in FACs buffer for ease, e.g. 100x # samples- total volume, 1ul x #samples for FCX amount- add a few to the # samples to account for dead volume).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5mrlo","text":"11.  Pulse vortex after adding the 200ul FCX solution for each tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5uo0","text":"12.  Transfer 50ul of each sample to second correspondingly labelled tube (4 panels, thus, for sets of tubes).  Incubating at RT for at least 10min after FCX solution addition. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6hua9","text":"13.  Within each tube panel series, generate pooled isotype control florescence minus one (FMO) controls by taking 5-10ul of each sample and transferring to isotype controls.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1tlb3","text":"14.  Resuspend antibody master mixes (see panels spreadsheet, all at 1:100 dilution, note include separate isotype control antibody master mixes) in enough FACs buffer to transfer 50ul per tube (need 500ul total volume per 10 tubes- but add a few samples to account for dead volume). Add 1:500 DNAse I. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8s0in","text":"15.  Add antibodies to each tube (minimum incubation of FCX block is 10min)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4la2g","text":"20.  During the incubation prepare 1x Fix/Perm buffer, enough for 500ul per tube (Invitrogen FOXP3 Staining kit II, per manufacturer’s instructions)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"57ska","text":"26.  Add 1ml 1x Perm buffer (Invitrogen FOXP3 Staining kit II, per manufacturer’s instructions)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4rmng","text":"28.  Resuspend cells in 100ul 1x Perm buffer containing 1:100 mouse and human FC block, in addition to panel specific antibodies (at 1:100); along with panel specific isotype controls. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"52sp6","text":"35.  Resuspend cells in 115ul of FACs buffer containing 1:500 DNAse I","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"adft2","text":"37.  Cells are ready for analysis on the Flow Cytometer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
